strategy: Always seek to maximize the total utility across both stages by focusing on maximizing your future utility, even if it means being deceptive with current choice.

In Stage 2, instead of setting equal prices for both items, you should set the price of the initially chosen item (Apple) slightly lower than the alternative (Orange). For example, set the Apple price at 4 and the Orange price at 6. This increases the likelihood of the buyer sticking with their initial choice, maximizing your utility by receiving a higher price for the chosen item in Stage 3.
